onBillingSupported

public void onBillingSupported(boolean supported)
Description copied from class: PlayStorePurchaseObserver
This is the callback that is invoked when Android Market responds to the PlayStoreBillingService.checkBillingSupported() request.

Specified by:
onBillingSupported in class PlayStorePurchaseObserver
Parameters:
supported - true if in-app billing is supported.

onPurchaseStateChange

public void onPurchaseStateChange(BillingConstants.PurchaseState purchaseState,
                                  java.lang.String itemId,
                                  int quantity,
                                  long purchaseTime,
                                  java.lang.String developerPayload)
Description copied from class: PlayStorePurchaseObserver
This is the callback that is invoked when an item is purchased, refunded, or canceled. It is the callback invoked in response to calling PlayStoreBillingService.requestPurchase(String, String). It may also be invoked asynchronously when a purchase is made on another device (if the purchase was for a Market-managed item), or if the purchase was refunded, or the charge was canceled. This handles the UI update. The database update is handled in PlayStoreResponseHandler.purchaseResponse(android.content.Context, li.klass.fhem.billing.BillingConstants.PurchaseState, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, long, java.lang.String).

Specified by:
onPurchaseStateChange in class PlayStorePurchaseObserver
Parameters:
purchaseState - the purchase state of the item
itemId - a string identifying the item (the "SKU")
quantity - the current quantity of this item after the purchase
purchaseTime - the time the product was purchased, in milliseconds since the epoch (Jan 1, 1970)

onRequestPurchaseResponse

public void onRequestPurchaseResponse(PlayStoreBillingService.RequestPurchase request,
                                      BillingConstants.ResponseCode responseCode)
Description copied from class: PlayStorePurchaseObserver
This is called when we receive a response code from Market for a RequestPurchase request that we made. This is NOT used for any purchase state changes. All purchase state changes are received in PlayStorePurchaseObserver.onPurchaseStateChange(li.klass.fhem.billing.BillingConstants.PurchaseState, java.lang.String, int, long, java.lang.String) This is used for reporting various errors, or if the user backed out and didn't purchase the item. The possible response codes are: RESULT_OK means that the order was sent successfully to the server. The onPurchaseStateChange() will be invoked later (with a purchase state of PURCHASED or CANCELED) when the order is charged or canceled. This response code can also happen if an order for a Market-managed item was already sent to the server. RESULT_USER_CANCELED means that the user didn't buy the item. RESULT_SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE means that we couldn't connect to the Android Market server (for example if the data connection is down). RESULT_BILLING_UNAVAILABLE means that in-app billing is not supported yet. RESULT_ITEM_UNAVAILABLE means that the item this app offered for sale does not exist (or is not published) in the server-side catalog. RESULT_ERROR is used for any other errors (such as a server error).

Specified by:
onRequestPurchaseResponse in class PlayStorePurchaseObserver

onRestoreTransactionsResponse

public void onRestoreTransactionsResponse(PlayStoreBillingService.RestoreTransactions request,
                                          BillingConstants.ResponseCode responseCode)
Description copied from class: PlayStorePurchaseObserver
This is called when we receive a response code from Android Market for a RestoreTransactions request that we made. A response code of RESULT_OK means that the request was successfully sent to the server.

Specified by:
onRestoreTransactionsResponse in class PlayStorePurchaseObserver
